Text: "Being your First Lady has been the greatest honor of my life, and I hope I made you proud." —The First Lady https://t.co/8INNaOIdt1
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “Don’t ever let anyone make you feel like you don’t matter, or like you don’t have a place in our American story – you do.” –The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "You see, our glorious diversity of faiths, colors and creeds is not a threat to who we are – it makes us who we are.” –The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “If you work hard, if you get a good education, anything is possible - that’s what the American Dream is all about.” –The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “If you or your parents are immigrants - you are part of a proud American tradition that has made us the greatest country on earth.” -FLOTUS
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “I want our young people to know that this country belongs to you – to all of you, from every background and walk of life.” –The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I can think of no better message to send our young people in my last official speech as First Lady." -The First Lady #ReachHigher
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “Our school counselors are truly among the heroes of the #ReachHigher story.” –The First Lady celebrating the work of school counselors.

Text: “Today, the high school graduation rate is at a record high and more young people than ever before are going to college.” –The First Lady

Text: RT @ObamaWhiteHouse : Watch live: @FLOTUS welcomes students, along with some special guests, for her final harvest of the Kitchen Garden: https://t.co/Hys40q7QvK https://t.co/e4bhBY9UMJ
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: RT @WholeKidsFnd : In partnership with @FLOTUS we’ve been able to place more than 4,400 #schoolsaladbars in cafeterias! That's a lot of #veggies! #LetsMove
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: RT @FoodCorps : "If we have the courage to plant a seed...we never know what might grow. That's what this garden has taught me." —@FLOTUS #LetsMove https://t.co/xEbHN46ZTm
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I'm hopeful that future first families will cherish this garden like we have" -The First Lady on the @WhiteHouse Kitchen Garden. #LetsMove
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: This garden will live on as a symbol of the hopes that we all hold of growing a healthier nation for our children. -The First Lady #LetsMove
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I didn't just take on this issue as First Lady - but as a mother who cares deeply about the health of my daughters." -The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "This has truly become a movement...and it certainly won't end when I leave the @WhiteHouse." -The First Lady #LetsMove
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Childhood obesity rates in this country have stopped rising and they've even started falling for our youngest kids." -The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "50 million kids had access to healthier meals and snacks at school." -The First Lady on the impact of #LetsMove.
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "11 million kids attended a @LetsMove Active School where they can get 60 minutes of physical activity a day." -The First Lady #LetsMove
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Today, 81 million Americans woke up in @LetsMove Cities, Towns and Counties." -The First Lady #LetsMove
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "This garden helped us start a national conversation about how we live and eat." -The First Lady on the impact of the Kitchen Garden.
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "The number of schools with gardens in DC alone has increased by 50 percent since 2011." -The First Lady on the impact of the Kitchen Garden
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We’ve inspired countless folks across this country to plant gardens of their own." -The First Lady on the impact of #LetsMove.
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "And the first ever @WhiteHouse pollinator garden to provide a home for our birds, butterflies & bees" -The First Lady on the Kitchen Garden
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We created the first ever @WhiteHouse compost system to highlight the importance of healthy soil." -The First Lady #LetsMove
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Kids from across this country blew us away with their enthusiasm, returning season after season to plant & harvest." -The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Folks from the @NatlParkService cared for this garden with such skill – and such heart – day in and day out." -The First Lady #LetsMove
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "So I had this idea – what if we planted a garden on the South Lawn to start a conversation about where our food comes from" -The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I started thinking about the challenges that my family and other families, were facing as we tried to raise healthy kids." -The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "The idea for this garden was actually born months before my family even set foot in the @WhiteHouse." -The First Lady #LetsMove
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "This is my baby- this is where it all started." -The First Lady on the @WhiteHouse Kitchen Garden. #LetsMove https://t.co/qaiMzn5mJs
Name: First Lady- Archived

Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "You are now part of a proud #KidsStateDinner tradition" of extraordinary young people —The First Lady

Text: "When you give your body the best possible fuel, you have more energy. You get stronger. And you just feel better in general every day."

Text: "Nothing is going to stop you from fulfilling your dreams." —The First Lady to @CityCollegeNY grads. 🎓 #ReachHigher https://t.co/ugkyAWiOEp
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: RT @CityCollegeNY : For final commencement address as First Lady, "I wanted to be here to celebrate all of you, this school, this city." https://t.co/l8euGeIes5
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "You all are the living, breathing proof that the American Dream endures in our time." —The First Lady to the @CityCollegeNY Class of 2016
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Public education is our greatest pathway to opportunity in America, so we need to invest in and strengthen our public universities" —FLOTUS
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "It means reaching back to help young people who've been left out and left behind, helping them prepare for college" —FLOTUS #ReachHigher
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "That means raising your hand at that board meeting and asking: 'Whose voices aren't being heard? What ideas are we missing?'" —FLOTUS
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Nothing is going to stop you from fulfilling your dreams, and you deserve every last one of the successes that I know you will have."
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "You should never ever be embarrassed by those struggles. You should never view your challenges as a disadvantage" —FLOTUS at @CityCollegeNY
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text:
"Neither of my parents went past high school."
"They saved up every penny that my dad earned."
"They were determined to send me to college."
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Our greatness has always come from people who expect nothing and take nothing for granted." —The First Lady at @CityCollegeNY #ReachHigher
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "In America, we don't let our differences tear us apart. Because we know that our greatness comes when we appreciate each other's strengths"
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "That is the power of our differences to make us smarter, and more creative." —The First Lady at @CityCollegeNY #ReachHigher
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Talent and effort—combined with our various backgrounds and life experiences—has always been the lifeblood of our singular American genius"
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "For centuries, this city has been the gateway to America for so many striving, hope-filled immigrants" —The First Lady at @CityCollegeNY

Text: "No matter where your journey started, you have all made it here today through...unyielding determination, sacrifice, and hard work" —FLOTUS

Text: "At this school, you represent more than 150 nationalities. You speak more than 100 different languages" —The First Lady at @CityCollegeNY

Text: "This is my last chance to share my love, admiration, & hopefully a little bit of wisdom with a graduating class" —FLOTUS at @CityCollegeNY
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “Hold fast to your goals.” —The First Lady celebrating the #NativeYouth of @SFIS_Braves: https://t.co/nNlNSbQq8J https://t.co/j5JvtjiQjt
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: You did it! You made it! Congrats @SFIS_Braves graduates, you make us all so proud. 🎓 #ReachHigher https://t.co/2YEajwJn7L
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I can't wait to see everything you will achieve and bring back to your communities." —The First Lady to the @SFIS_Braves Class of 2016
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I hope you will always remember your story and that you will carry your story with you as proudly as I carry mine." —FLOTUS to @SFIS_Braves
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I try my best to pass down to my girls that same love and that same dreaming spirit that Marian and Fraser Robinson passed down to me."
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Your big, impossible dreams are actually just the right size. And you have everything you need to achieve them." —FLOTUS to @SFIS_Braves
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Graduates, today all of that lives inside of you, all of that history, all of that sacrifice, all of that love." —FLOTUS to @SFIS_Braves
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Your communities have seeds that your ancestors have been planting and harvesting for 1000s of years, long before America was even an idea"
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Because by facing adversity head on and getting through it, you have gained wisdom and maturity beyond your years." —FLOTUS to @SFIS_Braves
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text:
"Those struggles should never be a source of shame."
"Those struggles are the source of your greatest strengths."
—FLOTUS to @SFIS_Braves
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "You have already faced—and overcome—challenges in your lives that most young people can’t even begin to imagine" —FLOTUS to @SFIS_Braves
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "More than ever before, our world needs you too." —The First Lady to the @SFIS_Braves Class of 2016
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Because your communities need you, they need you to develop your potential and become who you are meant to be." —FLOTUS to the @SFIS_Braves
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: RT @ReachHigher : "I want you to reach out and ask for help...No one gets through college alone. No one. I certainly didn't" @FLOTUS https://t.co/TsGMd2G2Qn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "The minute you feel like you’re struggling, the minute, I want you to ask for help." —The First Lady to @SFIS_Braves on going to college
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text:
"Hold fast to your goals"
"Push through any obstacles that may come your way"
—The First Lady to the @SFIS_Braves Class of 2016 #ReachHigher
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "As you begin the next phase of your journey, please remember that your communities need even more of your energy and expertise." —FLOTUS
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Every day at this school, you’ve been weaving together thousands of years of your heritage with the realities of your modern lives" —FLOTUS
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Nearly all of you are going on to college." —The First Lady to the @SFIS_Braves Class of 2016 #ReachHigher
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Today, the Native languages that were once strictly forbidden here now echo through the hallways." —The First Lady to the @SFIS_Braves
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "This school was founded as part of a deliberate, systematic effort to extinguish your cultures" —The First Lady to the @SFIS_Braves
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Your stories, your achievements, your contributions, and the story of this school inspire me." —The First Lady to the @SFIS_Braves
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I learned integrity from my parents, that living a good life is not about being wealthy or powerful. It’s about being honest." —FLOTUS
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Your values, the values that infuse this school, are the very same values that my parents handed down to me." —FLOTUS to @SFIS_Braves
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "There is nowhere I would rather be than right here with all of you." —The First Lady to the @SFIS_Braves #ReachHigher #GenI
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I will never forget the look of pride on his face, and on my mom’s face, as I walked across the stage at @Princeton & @HarvardLaw" —FLOTUS
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "My parents were products of segregated schools & neither of them had an education past high school…they wanted their kids to go to college"
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I am the granddaughter of Fraser Robinson Jr., who left the only life he’d ever known to move his family north." —The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I am the great-granddaughter of Fraser Robinson, an illiterate houseboy who taught himself to read and became an entrepreneur." —FLOTUS
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I am the great-great-granddaughter of Jim Robinson, who was born in South Carolina and lived as a slave." —The First Lady telling her story
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I want to tell you about the people who came before me and how they made me who I am today." —The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "You did it. You're here. You made it. And we are all so very, very proud of you!" —FLOTUS to the @SFIS_Braves Class of 2016 #ReachHigher
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: RT @JacksonStateU : "I will pray for you every step of the way! - God bless you all."  -@FLOTUS to JSU graduates. #JSUGrad16
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “As you say here at @JacksonStateU, the world better get ready – because here you come.” –The First Lady to the Class of 2016. #JSUGrad16
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "If you choose faith and love –if you strive for dignity and excellence, then there is nothing you can’t achieve” –The First Lady #JSUGrad16
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “Graduates, my challenge to you today – is to honor the legacy of our past by making your mark on the future.”  –The First Lady #JSUGrad16
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “The march for civil rights isn’t just about African-Americans…it’s about all Americans.” –The First Lady the graduates of @JacksonStateU.
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We’ve got to stand side by side with all of our neighbors – straight, gay, lesbian, bisexual, and transgender." –The First Lady #JSUGrad16
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "If we fail to exercise our fundamental right to vote...so much of the progress we’ve fought for will be under threat." –The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Every single stride we have ever taken in this country – it all started with the ballot." –The First Lady to students at @JacksonStateU.
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We choose excellence – we choose to tune out all the noise and strive for excellence in everything that we do." –The First Lady #JSUGrad16
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We choose love – our love for our children and our commitment to leaving them a better world." –The First Lady at @JacksonStateU #JSUGrad16
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We simply do not allow space in our hearts, our minds, or our souls for darkness." –The First Lady to the graduates of @JacksonStateU.
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Question isn’t whether you’re going to come face-to-face with these issues – the question is how you’re going to respond." –The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We continue to make progress in America, but know that the shadows of the past haven't completely disappeared." –The First Lady #JSUGrad16
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “Graduates, even in these volatile times, it would be unfair for us to ignore the changes we have seen in a generation.” –The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “Yet too often, instead of celebrating this change, we have a tendency to focus on conflict and controversy.” –The First Lady #JSUGrad16
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “And people in this country are finally free to marry the person they love.” –The First Lady to the graduates of @JacksonStateU. #JSUGrad16
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “Our high school graduation rates are the highest on record…” –The First Lady on the progress over the past seven years. #JSUGrad16
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “That empathy, that preparation, that moral compass….have led to so much progress over the past seven years.” –The First Lady #JSUGrad16
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “I see him dedicating himself to helping folks – who often don’t have a voice – that is the work of his life.” –The First Lady on @POTUS
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “I’ve seen how, no matter what kind of ugliness is going on at any particular moment, Barack always stays the course.” –The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “To devote your life to making things better for those who will come after you.” –The First Lady on public service to @JacksonStateU grads.
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “I’ve walked this journey with Barack, I’ve gotten a pretty good look at what it means to rise above the fray.” –The First Lady #JSUGrad16
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “When I hear words like dignity and excellence – I think about my husband.” –The First Lady to the graduates of @JacksonStateU. #JSUGrad16
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "That is the well-worn path to Dr. King’s mountaintop that so many men and women before us have taken." –The First Lady #JSUGrad16
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “They rose up and combatted small-mindedness with dignity, with integrity.” –The First Lady on the students of @JacksonStateU in 1967.
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "You all are the “Superb Sixteen” – and you’re about to join a storied legacy from this university." –The First Lady to @JacksonStateU grads
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “These girls are our girls – every last one of them.” —The First Lady on the #62MillionGirls not in school today. #LetGirlsLearn

Text: “Why do we still too often value girls for their bodies instead of their minds?” —The First Lady at the @WorldBank #LetGirlsLearn

Text: “Why are girls still missing so many days of school because of their menstrual cycles?” —The First Lady on the barriers to girls' education
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “Why, in so many places, do we still see such glaring disparities between the education of boys and girls?” —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: “To promote development, then we need to educate and empower women.” —The First Lady on the impact of #LetGirlsLearn at the @WorldBank.

https://t.co/MbMTiMVRNK
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: RT @googleargentina : En el CMD, @FLOTUS da un mensaje de empoderamiento a un gran grupo de estudiantes argentinas https://t.co/ctpUtHEsxE https://t.co/ZP4him3yUS
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I urge you to raise your voices...build a better world for young women all across the globe." —The First Lady https://t.co/BNUunVkFtT
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Every single one of you can be a leader in this movement to empower each other." —The First Lady to students in Argentina #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "#62milliongirls across the globe are not in school... imagine for a minute what it's like to be one of those girls." —The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I want to urge you to get the education you need to make your voice heard in the world." —The First Lady in Argentina #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Because of my education, I had opportunities that my parents never could have dreamed of for themselves." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I decided not to listen to the voices of those who doubted me. Instead, I decided to listen to my own voice" —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I would lie awake at night with those doubts eating away at my heart." —The First Lady on pursuing her goals as a young girl #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I started to question myself... Was I too loud - or too much?  Was I too bossy? Was I dreaming too big?" —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Messages that said as a girl, my voice was somehow less important." —The First Lady on those who didn't support her dreams. #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "The hopes I had for myself were in conflict with the messages I was receiving from people around me." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "People who thought a girl shouldn't have ambition." —The First Lady sharing the obstacles she faced growing up. #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Teachers who didn't think I was smart enough and would call on the boys in class over the girls." —The First Lady  #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I began encountering people who had less faith in my ability to reach my goals." —The First Lady in Argentina #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: Watch the First Lady's #LetGirlsLearn event in Argentina via @GoogleArgentina: https://t.co/7eNFe9ZoAm https://t.co/2bxyQntSIJ
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I dreamed of attending the best universities...and getting a job where I could be a leader in my community." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "My parents taught us that we could achieve anything through hard work and a good education." —The First Lady in Argentina #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "My modest upbringing, however, did not prevent me from having big dreams for myself." —The First Lady in Argentina #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Being here with all of you in Barracas, I truly feel at home. I grew up in a neighborhood just like this." —The First Lady  #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I want to thank all of you. So many smart, talented, wonderful young women from here in Barracas." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: The First Lady is in Argentina to talk about the power of an education. Watch via @GoogleArgentina: https://t.co/YaECN1NozO

Text: I am confident that we can serve our men and women in uniform and our veterans as well as they have served this country. —The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: If you’re a woman veteran, I want to ask you to stand tall and share your story. —The First Lady #WomenVets
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: If you’re a healthcare provider, make sure every veteran gets the care they’re entitled to. —The First Lady #WomenVets
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: If you’re a CEO, a hiring manager, raise the bar and commit to employing more women veterans. —The First Lady #WomenVets
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: If you’re a member of Congress, work with us to ensure that all of our veterans get the support they deserve. —The First Lady #WomenVets
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: Today, I want to challenge everyone – to take action on behalf of our women veterans. —The First Lady on supporting our #WomenVets.
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: We all have a role to play in supporting our #WomenVets. Every single one of us needs to step up and do our part. —The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: We set up a Women Veterans Call Center – staffed entirely by women – to answer questions for women veterans. —The First Lady #WomenVets
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: Over the past seven years, we’ve trained 2,400 veteran healthcare providers in women’s health. —The First Lady honoring #WomenVets
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: Women have sacrificed so much — they should never have to hide their accomplishments. —The First Lady on telling the story of our #WomenVets
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: One striking reality is that many women veterans don’t even self-identify as veterans. —The First Lady honoring #WomenVets
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: Thanks to brilliant, fearless women...more than 200,000 women are serving our country in just about every role and rank. —FLOTUS #WomenVets
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: RT @Cosmopolitan : .@FLOTUS's first #boomerang! Giving it up for girls' education with @Cosmpolitan.com's @prachigu 💁 #LetGirlsLearn https://t.co/mNAlyWedJw
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: Education opened doors I couldn't imagine as a girl from the South Side of Chicago. Let's give every child that chance. #LetGirlsLearn -mo
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I hope you all will keep working as hard as you can to educate every child on this planet." —The First Lady at #WISE15. #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "My university degrees transported me to places I never could have imagined: to boardrooms & courtrooms, to the @WhiteHouse. —FLOTUS #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "My education opened up opportunities that I never could've dreamed of as a young black girl from a working class family." —The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We know what's possible when we empower women and girls and give them the opportunities to develop their promise." —FLOTUS #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We need more countries here in the Middle East and across the globe to join us in these efforts" —The First Lady at #WISE15. #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Issues like girls' education and workplace equality have never been and will never be just women's issues." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We cannot build a modern workforce with outdated laws and attitudes that keep women from entering and thriving in our workplaces." —FLOTUS
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Girls who are educated also earn higher salaries—15 to 25 percent for each additional year of secondary school." —The First Lady #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Girls who are educated marry later, have lower rates of infant mortality." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Girls are so hungry to learn." —The First Lady on why we must help #LetGirlsLearn at #WISE15.
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "That's the only way to change hearts and minds: by empowering local leaders, by training local educators, by inspiring new conversations."
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Through #LetGirlsLearn, we're investing in girls' education in conflict zones. —The First Lady at #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "The U.S. Government launched #LetGirlsLearn, it's a new initiative to help adolescent girls worldwide go to school." —FLOTUS #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We also need to ensure that once they're educated, women can join the workforce." —The First Lady at #WISE15. #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We need to confront the myths about women's sexuality that are used to justify horrific practices like genital mutilation." —The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We need to condemn sexual assault for what it is: a violent crime that has no place in this world." —The First Lady #WISE15 #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Because if we truly want to keep girls safe, we need to transform this culture of impunity into a culture of consent." —The First Lady
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We cannot separate the issue of how we educate girls from the issue of how we treat women more broadly in our societies." #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "While we still have work to do...today, nearly 60 percent of American university students are women." —The First Lady at #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "In each generation, brave women—and men—fought to end gender discrimination in the workplace." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I was lucky because I had parent who believed in me, who had big dreams for me." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I was even told that I would never be admitted to a prestigious university, so I shouldn't even bother to apply." —FLOTUS #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Back when I was a girl...people were often more interested in hearing what my brother had to say." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "I say this as someone whose country has undergone a long and difficult struggle for women's equality." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Solving our girls' education crisis is definitely about resources, but it is also about attitudes and beliefs." —FLOTUS #LetGirlsLearn
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We need to connect them with technology, with training for high-tech jobs." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We need to build more schools, hire more teachers for girls." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "When girls do attend secondary school, they often do so at great risk." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "When it comes to secondary education, girls still lag far behind." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Right now, #62MillionGirls worldwide are not in school." —The First Lady: https://t.co/xzBLsIl16r #LetGirlsLearn #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "We need to make dramatic new investments in girls' education." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "Every child on this planet deserves the chance to fulfill their boundless potential." —The First Lady #LetGirlsLearn #WISE15
Name: First Lady- Archived

Text: "When we do educate girls – when we truly invest in their potential – there is no limit to the impact we can have." —FLOTUS #LetGirlsLearn

Text: "For every girl like me, there are so many others across the globe who are just as smart…but they never have the chance to attend school."

Text: "Being a professional made me a better mother because by pursuing my dreams, I was modeling for my girls how to pursue their dreams" —FLOTUS
